page.title: 10THE MERIDIAN LINE
page.content: IN JUNE 1984 THE PEOPLE OF SOMERSHAM CELEBRATED THE CENTENARY OF THE WORLD'S ADOPTION OF THE GREENWHICH GRID SYSTEM.THE MERIDIAN LINE PASSES THROUGH THE CHURCH, THE NEWSAGENTS AND THE SCHOOL IN SOMERSHAM. ON MERIDIAN DAY, 26 JUNE THE CHILDREN DRESSED UP IN THE COSTUMES OF THE OTHER COUNTRIES THROUGH WHICH THE MERIDIAN LINE PASSES. A WHITE LINE WAS PAINTED ALONG THE MERIDIAN WHICH WENT ACROSS THE PLAY- GROUND, OVER THE ROOF OF THE INFANT CLASSROOMS AND ACROSS THE PLAYING FIELD.THE CHILDREN HAD TEA ALONG THE LINE AND THE R.A.F. FLEW AEROPLANES OVERHEAD, TAKING PHOTOGRAPHS. ALL THE CHILDREN WERE GIVEN A FIRST DAY COVER WITH THE PARISH COUNCIL'S OWN SPECIALLY COMMISSIONED POSTMARK. LATER A TIME CAPSULE OF EVERYDAY OBJECTS WAS BURIED ON THE MERIDIAN.
